page.title: 08MUSHROOM FARMING
page.content: MUSHROOM FARMING The man who owns the mushroom farm is called Mr. Nutting. On his mushroom farm they grow four different types of mushrooms, Le-Lion, Syimcel, Oyster and Cream. Mushrooms have to be grown in a special mushroom compost. The compost is made from straw and horse manure. The first job is to plant the mushroom spores into the compost which is in trays. These trays are then placed into an air-conditioned room. Then a layer of peat is placed over the spores to cover them. They are then left for a week. During this time they turn fluffy and then they are ready for moving to a second air-conditioned room for a period of two weeks where they grow into mushrooms as we know them. The mushrooms are then picked for sale.
